docs.snippet: Under pressure from investors, Snap is making radical changes. Can it emulate Facebook without losing its innovative spirit?

headline.print_headline: If a wildly creative company with an app used by 178 million people every day can still be crushed by Facebook, how is anyone else supposed to succeed?
headline.main: Snapchat’s New Test: Grow Like Facebook, Without the Baggage

docs.snippet: Attempts by governments to rein them in might instead have to resemble diplomacy — a cautious search for detente with institutions that ultimately get to set their own laws.

docs.snippet: The company said it would turn over 3,000 ads linked to Russia to Congress after growing scrutiny about its role in last November’s presidential election.

docs.snippet: Sheryl Sandberg, Facebook’s chief operating officer, promised “more human review and oversight” to make sure offensive terms aren’t used to target ads.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Vows More Human Oversight of Ad Targeting
headline.main: Facebook, After ‘Fail’ Over Ads Targeting Racists, Makes Changes
